title: EU states approve Mercosur trade deal despite France's opposition
subhead: With this approval, the European Commission president, Ursula von der Leyen, could travel to Paraguay as early as Monday to sign the trade treaty with Latin America.

title: Iran cuts internet as protest movement against regime grows
Russian strike in Kyiv with hypersonic missile prompts calls of temporary evacuation
Northern Sudan watches the war from afar
subhead: War in Sudan: A Trapped Nation (6/6). The northern region of Sudan, spared so far from the fighting between the paramilitary Rapid Support Forces and the regular army, has taken in thousands of displaced people. But as the conflict drags on and draws closer, local militias are organizing.

title: France enjoys another banner year for tourism, buoyed by campgrounds and international visitors
subhead: International tourism revenue rose by 9% in France in 2025, according to the United Nations World Tourism Organization.

title: 'Christopher Columbus embodying Trump and Meloni's supremacist fantasies is no coincidence'
subhead: 'Debated Figures' (1/5). Once praised by French traditionalist Catholics, the 'discoverer of America' is now celebrated by American and Italian leaders, writes historian Romain Bertrand.

title: Killing of Renee Good in Minneapolis reignites US debate over ICE
subhead: The 37-year-old mother was shot dead by an Immigration and Customs Enforcement agent while maneuvering her vehicle on a street on Wednesday. Footage of the incident, which does not confirm the self-defense claim put forward by the Trump administration, has sparked outrage across the United States.

title: European political order 'in danger,' French foreign minister warns
Grok limits AI image editing to paid users after nudes backlash
French researcher held in Russia freed in prisoner swap
Steve Bannon backs Le Pen over 'lightweight' Bardella for French president
Syrian authorities declare ceasefire in Aleppo after deadly clashes
'Nero at the Elysée': A story of hope dashed by Macron's presidency
Eating too many preservatives could increase cancer and diabetes risks
France seeks to assert role in Caribbean after Trump's show of force
Israeli government accelerates settlement expansion in occupied West Bank
French ex-spy chief handed suspended jail sentence in attempted extortion case
China's Pingtan Island reflects rising tensions in the Taiwan Strait
Belgian multimillionaire aims to build a 'Caribbean Dubai' in the Antilles
'The raw and brutal display of American power in the Trump II era is finally opening the eyes of Washington's allies'
subhead: Europe finds itself in a perilous phase, having recognized its solitude but lacking the means for true autonomy, while the emotion created by the aggressiveness of empires calls for a response, writes Le Monde columnist Sylvie Kauffmann.

title: Venezuela: How the US spent months preparing the military operation to capture Maduro
subhead: Images verified by Le Monde made it possible to reconstruct the US's vast military deployment at sea, on land and in the air in the months leading up to the abduction of the Venezuelan president.

title: French judges alarmed by rumors of US sanctioning magistrates who sentenced Le Pen
subhead: Peimane Ghaleh-Marzban, the president of the Paris judicial court, spoke out to condemn what he called 'unacceptable interference.' His remarks followed revelations in the German press about the possibility that the United States might sanction the French judges who sentenced Marine Le Pen.

title: France's narrow path toward a budget
'Instead of commenting on the unthinkable, Europeans should take action in Greenland'
Under Trump, the feats of the US military regularly run into the great void of the 'day after'
